show.title: The Lord of the Rings:  The Fellowship of the Ring:  Extended Edition With Q&A
show.headline: One Ring To Rule Them All

event.title: <show-title>The Lord of the Rings:  The Fellowship of the Ring:  Extended Edition With Q&A</show-title>
event.headline: One ring to rule them all
event.description:
“You shall not pass!”

Enjoy a pre-recorded cast Q&A with your screening.

Millions of readers worldwide have their own ideas of what author J.R.R.Tolkien's Middle-earth should look and sound like. But their wildest imaginings could scarcely top the magnificent visuals of director Peter Jackson's THE LORD OF THE RINGS: THE FELLOWSHIP OF THE RING, the first of three epic films based on Tolkien's works.

The screenplay by Fran Walsh, Philippa Boyens, and Jackson is determinedly faithful to Tolkien's text, as it sends Frodo and his friends Sam (Sean Astin), Pippin (Billy Boyd), and Merry (Dominic Monaghan) off in the direction of the terrifying volcanic Mount Doom, where they must dispose of a cursed ring passed down to Frodo by his cousin Bilbo Baggins (Ian Holm). The treasure, possessing extraordinary destructive powers, was forged by Sauron ages ago and, should it fall into the wrong hands, it could spell the end of civilization. Getting rid of the ring is not easy, but with a fellowship of heroes at his back, Frodo heads out on a perilous journey to save the world.

show.title: Grease
show.headline: Summer lovin' lives on in this quintessential movie musical celebrating the '50s

event.title: <show-title>Grease</show-title> <event-type-title>SING-ALONG MOVIE PARTY</event-type-title>
event.headline: Rock and roll is here to stay at the GREASE Sing-Along
event.description:
We’re hopelessly devoted to GREASE, with its lovable characters, its doo-wop style, and, of course, those endlessly catchy tunes. To celebrate this timeless classic, we’re putting together an interactive, prop-filled, hand-jiving Sing-Along for all you T-Birds and Pink Ladies out there (beauty school dropouts also welcome).

We’ll kick things off with a pre-show hand jive contest before we start the interactive show, where you’ll have some candy cigarettes to help you look like a greaser, a comb so that you can comb-along to the action, ribbons, salon caps, and more. And because this is a Sing-Along, we’ll have the lyrics up onscreen to help every Danny, Sandy, Rizzo, and Kenickie in the audience get in on the fun.

So roll up the cuffs on those jeans, grab your respective black leather and pink satin jackets, theatrically comb your hair, and cruise on down to join us for the most rockin’ Sing-Along ever.

landscapeHeroImage.altText: Grease Sing Along Web SHOW Hero 1920x1080 v3

posterImage.altText: Grease Sing Along Web SHOW P 960x1400

show.title: Scream (2022)
show.headline: Can you follow the rules?

event.title: <show-title>Scream (2022)</show-title> <event-type-title>Brunch</event-type-title>
event.headline: There's a certain set of rules for surviving brunch
event.description:
Order from our tasty brunch menu – Egg BLT, French Toast, or Breakfast Tacos – and pair with a brunch cocktail classic like our Habanero Bloody Mary. Each are available to order along with our full menu at this special brunch screening.

Twenty-five years have passed since that first, deadly call was answered, and now a new killer has donned the Ghostface mask in Woodsboro. After a group of teens connected to the original murders are targeted, Sidney Prescott (Neve Campbell), Gale Weathers (Courteney Cox), and Dewey Riley (David Arquette) reunite to face their past. With the body count rising, they’re going to have to abide by certain rules if they want to survive.

SCREAM sees Neve Campbell, Courteney Cox, and David Arquette reprise their iconic roles to take on a new killer before history repeats itself. With all the thrills, chills, and kills you expect from this legendary franchise, you’ll fall in love with scary movies all over again. Just remember, it could be anyone behind the mask…

show.title: The Goonies
show.headline: Heyy yoouu guys!

event.title: <show-title>The Goonies</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Heyy yoouu guuyys! We're watching the Goonies!
event.description:
Let’s face it, THE GOONIES never gets old (and they never say “die”). With its endearing cast of quirky kids and a plot filled with swashbuckling adventure, it serves as the ultimate fantasy for anyone who feels stuck in the mundane humdrum of everyday life.

Now it’s your chance to be a Goonie. Join us for a rollicking movie party and we’ll give you everything you need to join the gang, including a pirate eye patch, a marbles bag and marbles, a bandana, and a fun-sized Baby Ruth, of course. And don’t worry, we won’t make you do the truffle shuffle to get in.

So, to everyone who ever wanted to be a Goonie (or for those of you meeting the Goonies for the very first time), join us as we escape into this daring, heartwarming story of lost treasure and enduring friendship.

show.title: The Lord of the Rings:  The Return of the King:  Extended Edition With Q&A
show.headline: The eye of the enemy is moving

event.title: <show-title>The Lord of the Rings:  The Return of the King:  Extended Edition With Q&A</show-title>
event.headline: The eye of the enemy is moving
event.description:
"One ring to rule them all. One ring to find them. One ring to bring them all and in the darkness bind them."

Enjoy a pre-recorded cast Q&A with your screening.

In the conclusion of J.R.R. Tolkien's epic masterpiece, The Lord of the Rings, armies mass for a final battle that will decide the fate of the world – and powerful, ancient forces of Light and Dark compete to determine the outcome – and one member of the Fellowship of the Ring is revealed as the noble heir to the throne of the Kings of Men.

Yet, the sole hope for triumph over evil lies with a brave hobbit, Frodo, who, accompanied only by his loyal friend Sam and the hideous, wretched Gollum, ventures deep into the very dark heart of Mordor on his seemingly impossible quest to destroy the Ring of Power.

Winner of 11 Academy Awards including Best Picture and Best Director!

show.headline: The battle for Middle-earth begins

event.title: <show-title>The Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers: Extended Edition With Q&A</show-title>
event.headline: They're taking the hobbits to Isengard
event.description:
“Now for wrath, now for ruin and the red dawn!”

Enjoy a pre-recorded cast Q&A with your screening.

The fellowship has failed, the kingdoms of men are crumbling, and two small hobbits head out alone on an impossible journey to save Middle-earth. Peter Jackson’s astounding take on J.R.R. Tolkein’s classic novel may start on a dire note, but it remains a triumphant vision of the power of good to persevere in the face of reckless hate.

The second movie in this epic trilogy sees our heroes traveling separate paths in their fight against the forces of Mordor. Frodo and his loyal friend Sam must make an uneasy alliance with the hideous Gollum. Aragorn, Legolas, and Gimli become embroiled in the fight to save Rohan from Saruman’s massive army of Uruk-hai. Merry and Pippin must convince an ancient race to join the fight. The battle for Middle-earth is about to begin.

show.title: American Graffiti
show.headline: Cruise down the boulevard in George Lucas’ hangout classic

show.title: Pretty in Pink
show.headline: From Duckies to Blanes, all are welcome to join us to this John Hughes comedy

event.title: <show-title>Pretty in Pink</show-title> <event-type-title>Brunch</event-type-title>
event.headline: From Duckies to Blanes, all can join us in the best meal of the day – brunch
event.description:
Order from our tasty brunch menu – Egg BLT, French Toast, or Breakfast Tacos – and pair with a brunch cocktail classic like Desert Spring Water or the Italian 75. Each are available to order along with our full menu at this special brunch screening.

As far as we’re concerned, PRETTY IN PINK is the definitive guide to the classification of high school boys. Sure, fashion and hairstyles have changed (was Andrew McCarthy's hair ever cool?), but the universal truth of the film remains: if you're a teenage dude, you're either a Duckie or a Blane.

The Duckies of the world are typically adorable and goofy, but they're just never gonna make it out of the friend zone. The Blanes, on the other hand, were born to be hot and popular, so of course they take everything for granted and don't appreciate the awesome, amazing girls right in front of them. In other words, dating in high school sucks.

Fortunately, PRETTY IN PINK channels that suckage through Molly Ringwald, light of our lives, and wraps it all up in a fabulous '80s package. The music! Iona's wardrobe! Iona's hair! James Spader! The prom dress! Ok, well, not so much the prom dress.

Slip on your finest pink ensemble (bonus points if you sew it yourself) and start practicing your Otis Redding lip synch routine now!

show.title: Pride & Prejudice (2005)
show.headline: Sometimes the last person you want to be with is the one you cannot be without

event.title: <show-title>Pride & Prejudice (2005)</show-title> <event-type-title>Brunch</event-type-title>
event.headline: Experience the greatest love story of all time with the greatest brunch foods
event.description:
Order from our tasty brunch menu – Egg BLT, French Toast, or Breakfast Tacos – and pair with a brunch cocktail classic like Desert Spring Water or the Italian 75. Each are available to order along with our full menu at this special brunch screening.

Set in the picturesque countryside of 18th century England, PRIDE & PREJUDICE tells Jane Austen’s classic tale of finding love in the last place you’d expect. Joe Wright’s (DARKEST HOUR) acclaimed adaptation sees Elizabeth Bennet (Kiera Knightley, THE IMITATION GAME) under pressure from her overbearing mother to marry a suitable man. When the stoic yet intriguing (and incredibly wealthy) Mr. Darcy (Matthew Macfadyen, DEATH AT A FUNERAL) visits their small town, Elizabath opens herself up to life, happiness, and love.

show.title: The Twilight Saga: Twilight
show.headline: When you can live forever, what do you live for?

event.title: <show-title>The Twilight Saga: Twilight</show-title> <event-type-title>Brunch</event-type-title>
event.headline: When you can live forever what do you live for? Brunch!
event.description:
Order from our tasty brunch menu – Egg BLT, French Toast, or Breakfast Tacos – and pair with a brunch cocktail classic like Desert Spring Water or the Italian 75. Each are available to order along with our full menu at this special brunch screening.

TWILIGHT is an action-packed, modern-day love story between a teen girl and a vampire. Bella Swan (Kristen Stewart) has always been a bit different, never fitting in with the girls at her school. When Bella is sent to live with her father in the rainy little town of Forks, Washington, she doesn’t expect much to change. Then she meets the mysterious and dazzlingly beautiful Edward Cullen (Robert Pattinson), a boy unlike any she’s ever met. Edward is a vampire, but he doesn’t have fangs and his family is unique in that they choose not to drink human blood. Edward has been waiting 90 years for a soul mate, which he finds in Bella. They are soon swept up in a passionate and unorthodox romance. Edward must struggle to resist the primal pull of her scent, which could send him into an uncontrollable frenzy, but what will they do when a clan of new vampires – James (Cam Gigandet), Laurent (Edi Gathegi) and Victoria (Rachelle Lefevre) – come to town and threaten to disrupt their way of life?

marketStrings.value: The personal closed captioning device displays feature film dialogue and other audio in the form of English-language text for individuals who are deaf or hard of hearing.

The descriptive audio headset provides individuals who are blind or have low vision with an English-language narration of the details of the feature presentation that can't be understood by the soundtrack alone.

The assisted listening headset provides an amplified audio signal for those individuals who are hard of hearing. A 3.5mm headphone jack is available to drive hearing aids, neck loops, or cochlear implants.
You may not enter a movie after it has started. If you show up to your desired screening late, we will happily exchange your ticket for a different showtime or for a raincheck to a future show.

sessionAttributes.name: All Ages
sessionAttributes.description: Get ready for maximum family fun! Our All Ages screenings include pre-show activity sheets and crayons, a relaxed noise policy, kids menus, and a free prize for kids 12 and under. All ages welcome with a parent or guardian.

sessionAttributes.name: Brunch
sessionAttributes.description: Both our regular and Brunch menus are available at this screening. Arrive hungry.

sessionAttributes.name: Kid Friendly
sessionAttributes.description: Grab the fam and let the fun begin! Our Kid Friendly screenings include pre-show activity sheets and crayons, a relaxed noise policy, kids menus, and a free prize for kids 12 and under. Ages 3+ welcome with a parent or guardian.

sessionAttributes.name: Sensory Friendly
sessionAttributes.description: Our all-inclusive screenings welcome babies, infants, nursing moms, and guests with Autism and other sensory needs. Sound will be quieter. Theater will be a little less dark. Chatter, walking around, and babies being babies are A-OK.

formats.headline: Digital format projected using a digital projector.
formats.description: Digital format projected using a digital projector.

agePolicies.name: All Ages
agePolicies.description: All ages including babies are welcome with parent or guardian.

agePolicies.name: !!DO NOT USE!! Standard (2201)
agePolicies.description:
Children ages 3+ admitted before 6pm.
Children ages 6+ admitted after 6pm.
All minors under the age of 18 must be accompanied by an adult.

agePolicies.name: Rated G
agePolicies.description: Guests under 18 must be accompanied by an adult. Children 3 and up allowed for shows that start before 6pm. Ages 6 and up after 6pm.

agePolicies.name: Rated PG
agePolicies.description: Guests under 18 must be accompanied by an adult. Children 3 and up allowed for shows that start before 6pm. Ages 6 and up after 6pm.

agePolicies.name: Rated PG-13 (Standard) (2201)
agePolicies.description: 18 and up. Guests ages 6-17 are welcome any time with a parent or guardian.

agePolicies.name: Rated PG with Adult Focus (2201)
agePolicies.description: 18 and up. Guests ages 6-17 are welcome any time with a parent or guardian.

agePolicies.name: Rated R (2201)
agePolicies.description: 18 and up. Guests ages 6-17 are welcome any time with a parent or guardian.
